CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 30, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "The Simpson Smile - Lieut. Gen. William H. Simpson, commander of the famed Ninth Army, relaxes in his staff car as the line forms for the big parade. A large number of Negro troops were included in elements of the Ninth, which raced across France and Germany as the Allies swept on to victory.  General Simpson used mixed groups in several operations, and their esprit de corps made them 'an unbeatable combination.' - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Woman driving men, including Lieut. Gen. William H. Simpson, in convertible car with sign also for Major Horn, in parade at airport
